instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.I2C_BKLT_SDA: What is I2C_BKLT_SDA? I2C_BKLT_SDA is a data line between the LCD screen and the LED driver. This data line cannot short to ground. If it does, the screen cannot talk to the LED driver, and the LED driver will not allow the circuit to produce a backlight..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight issue
threads.message:
Hi , ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with a backlight problem
<TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> is not being told to turn on , pin 3 12.4v pin 4 12.5v pin 1,2,5 and 6 0v, 
<RESISTOR>R7731</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7732</RESISTOR> lcdbklt fb measure fine also tracks are good
no short either side of <DIODE>D7710</DIODE>
at <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> pin5 5v pin18 5V pin 17 bklt en 3.3v
<SIGNAL>I2C_BKLT_SCL</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>I2C_BKLT_SDA</SIGNAL> tracks are fine from screen connector to <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> , pullup resistors <RESISTOR>R7753</RESISTOR> 5.13v and <RESISTOR>R7752</RESISTOR> 4.86v
no signs of a short, changed <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR>, all the resistors i have mentioned just incase plus <TRANSISTOR>Q7701</TRANSISTOR> just for good measure and still no joy, am i missing something, also its good working screen and have 5v on l8300

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight issue
threads.message: Is there an image? Is it a known good 2015 LCD? <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high? Connector inspected for damage? Any history?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight issue
threads.message: yes has image on screen, lcd 100% good for 2105, <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 3.3V lcd connector looks ok but would it be worth changing just incase ?. history of laptop is we changed the screen 2 - 3 months ago due to laptop being dropped but apart from that no water damage or anything like that, apparently just didnt work one day

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight issue
threads.message: PRAM reset done? If you are relying on the screen being 3 months old and thus must be ok then first thing to try is another LCD.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> backlight issue
threads.message: out of complete desperation i changed the lcd connector even though it looked fine and the feedback lines measured ok and now i have backlight :-)
